Home.Title: Redistributing Wealth in the San Antonio Community

0.title: Redistributing Wealth
0.body: Trinity Mutual Aid is a student-run organization (unaffiliated with Trinity University) that focuses on redistributing wealth within the San Antonio community. Our organization provides aid to those in need of financial assistance with medical expenses, housing expenses, and food insecurity. We do so in hopes of strengthening community connections so we can fulfill collective needs together.

1.title: How we Started
1.body: TMA was created in the fall of 2020 with a primary focus of combating food insecurity. Pantry runs were our primary form of outreach. Our focus expanded in February of 2021, when the winter storm that hit Texas created a huge need for aid. We provided aid to folks in need of assistance with utility bills, medical bills, and more, as well as distributing essential cold-weather items to houseless folks.

2.title: A Wider Network of Aid
2.body: We have affiliated with local non-profit Community Housing Resource Partners, an organization that focuses on developing affordable housing to promote “self-sufficiency, education, health and wellness, and stable communities.” This partnership ensures long-term sustainability in our organization so that we can continue to provide aid within the community.

0.title: Donate!
0.body: Make a financial contribution to Trinity Mutual Aid to continue supporting the San Antonio community! Help keep food pantries and fridges stocked and provide assistance for folks who need funds with medical expenses, housing, and utility expenses. Keep up with our news page to check out how contributions have helped us redistribute aid throughout the area! We are able to process donations through online platforms. Make a one-time contribution or become a recurring donor!

3.title: How many times/how often may I request aid from TMA?
3.body: We operate on one application per ‘cycle’ in times of high demand. Each ‘cycle’ will be dependent on the amount of requests received and funds we have available. New cycle periods will be updated regularly on our request aid page.

5.title: What is a pantry run?
5.body: Pantry runs consist of volunteers individually purchasing groceries and other necessities (batteries, diapers, menstrual products, etc) to stock up local food pantries and fridges. These pantries and fridges operate independently throughout San Antonio and serve their neighbors on a ‘take what you need, give what you can’ basis. Once volunteers purchase their groceries, TMA is able to reimburse them for the total amount with proof of receipt. If you’re interested in more information regarding pantry runs or would like to be reimbursed for one, please contact us via our contact page!

6.title: What is Mutual Aid?
6.body1: "When people band together to meet immediate survival needs, usually because of a shared understanding that the systems in place aren't coming to meet them, or certainly not fast enough."
6.body2: An important note is that non-profit work and mutual aid work ARE DIFFERENT.
